title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Apple CEO Cook faced tough questions from the judge who will decide whether the iPhone maker operates an improper monopoly, including about the competitiveness of its App Store payment system.

---

As older fossil-fuel power plants across the U.S. shut down in favor of renewable energy, some are getting a new lease on life through bitcoin mining.

---

Existing-home sales fell 2.7% in April from March, marking the third straight monthly drop amid high prices and tight inventory.

---

The S&P 500 ended 0.08% lower after another volatile session, while the Nasdaq fell 0.5%. The Dow rose 0.4%.

---

Google's DeepMind told staff late last month that the parent company had ended long-running talks over the artificial-intelligence unit's desire for more autonomy.

---

Kansas City Southern said it would combine with Canadian National in a roughly $30 billion deal.

---

Tribune Publishing said that its shareholders voted to approve a takeover offer from hedge fund Alden.

---

German publishing conglomerate Axel Springer is in talks to purchase digital-news outlet Axios.
